result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos E. Acevedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant to participate in a Batterer's Treatment program.
Parenting Classes.
Provide a DNA sample if one has not previously been provided.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carlos E. Acevedo in court.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Count one, Per Order signed on October 5, 2015:  JOC shall be amended to reflect that the repeater enhancer on count one is Section 939.62(1)(a).

Received and filed:
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review.
DOC letter requesting clarification of repeater enhancer.
ADA Lindsay called and informed the court that there will be no need for a restitution hearing.  Hearing date vacated.

Defendant Carlos E. Acevedo in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Defendant Carlos E. Acevedo in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statement as to sentencing by the parties.  Additional statement by:  Annette L.
As to count 2:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for -0- days time served.  
As to count 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS, consecutive to count 2 and the sentence the defendant is now serving.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION 1 YEAR. Credit given for -0- days time served if revoked.
.
COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction, STAYED.
- Defendant to participate in a Batterer's Treatment program.
- Parenting Classes
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department;
-absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs;
-random urine screens;
- Obtain and maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
-pay restitution in the amount of $100.00 to be paid to Ashley S.
-provide a DNA sample if one has not previously been provided;
-Defendant to pay all surcharges plus costs during the period of probation; if not paid civil judgment to be entered.
-Defendant to have no contact with the victim.  Defendant may have 3rd party contact to visit with his children as approved by agent.
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Acknowledgment of ineligibility  Copies given to defendant. 
A restitution hearing will be scheduled to determine if any other restitution is owed.
Case adjourned for a probation review hearing in Branch 36 on 02/19/2016 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNT 1 & 2 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Defendant Carlos E. Acevedo in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Defendant Carlos E. Acevedo in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case RECALLED. Defendant now present in court. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court Amended Count 1 to Battery, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(b), a class A Misdemeanor.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court Amended Count 2 to REMOVE the Repeater enhancer 939.62(1)(a)

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku in court, defendant Carlos E. Acevedo not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Defendant NOT produced for 1st call. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Court passed case to have defendant produced.

Attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku in court, defendant Carlos E. Acevedo not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel request to set matter for a Plea hearing. Case remains set for Jury Trial, court will hear plea on 7/13/2015. State will have witnesses on call. Case adjourned to branch 23.

Attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku in court, defendant Carlos E. Acevedo not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case set for Final Pretrial. Defense counsel requests an additional Final Pretrial date. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku in court.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carlos E. Acevedo in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Defendant Carlos E. Acevedo in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Jeanine See.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.   Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ashley S. and C.S. (her child).

Defendant Carlos E. Acevedo in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Carlos E. Acevedo in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Defense counsel enters not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
